arts.ttl: Colchester United boss Danny Cowley on Bromley victory
arts.sum: “We just made some technical errors going into half-time and because of the way that they play, they create real sustained pressure and you then have to stand up and be counted and defend your box, stop crosses and defend really well, which thankfully we did.” “I thought in the first half hour, we were really good and then probably in the last 15 minutes of the first half, we just lost a little bit of our rhythm and stopped connecting passes and you have to take the ball off them and you have to try and get a control and a rhythm because they’re a heavyweight boxer and we’re not.

arts.ttl: Colchester United claim victory over Bromley in League Two
arts.sum: Jamie McDonnell's 11th-minute header from Jack Payne's corner was headed off the line by former Colchester defender Omar Sowunmi, while five minutes later Payne denied by goalkeeper Grant Smith from point blank range after Edwards had done brilliantly down the left and create the chance. And the U's almost doubled their advantage just after the hour mark when Taylor's low shot from close range was well saved by Smith and soon after, Mandela Egbo's fierce 25-yard strike was parried away by the Bromley goalkeeper, as the visitors pressed for a second.

arts.ttl: Colchester get back to winning ways with victory at Bromley
arts.sum: Owura Edwards’ fourth-minute goal was enough for the visitors.

arts.ttl: Tempers flare as Colchester United under-21s are beaten by AFC Bournemouth
arts.sum: The visitors took the lead on 16 minutes in a break and when Charlie Osborne found Ash Clarke on his left he scored with a shot which took a very big deflection. Eight minutes later Bournemouth were very unlucky when a deflected shot hit the top of the bar and over it, then just after that an away effort was blocked in the goalmouth by Fela Abidkun and then to be scrambled clear.

arts.ttl: Colchester United travel to play Bromley in League Two
arts.sum: Colchester will check on the fitness of Ellis Iandolo and Teddy Bishop ahead of the game against Bromley. He is set to come up against former Braintree Town striker Michael Cheek, who has scored 14 times for Bromley in 27 appearances, this season.

arts.ttl: Frankie Terry making a name for himself at Colchester United
arts.sum: Terry made his first league start for Colchester at left-back and came on in that position as a half-time substitute in their EFL Trophy defeat at Cheltenham Town, on Tuesday night following an injury to Ellis Iandolo. He said: “When I first started playing left-back a couple of years ago, we went through a few different little bits on positioning and it’s really helped.

arts.ttl: Why Colchester United's hunt for transfer window signings is collective effort
arts.sum: Cowley is probably involved more in this window than the previous two he has experienced as the U’s head coach, following the recent departure of Simon Bassey, who had been leading the club’s player recruitment drive since the summer and prior to that, Ross Embleton, who had been their full-time head of recruitment. Colchester might be currently without a sporting director or head of recruitment but there are plenty of people at Florence Park assisting Danny and Nicky Cowley with their hunt for new players, this month.

arts.ttl: Colchester United Women suffer rare defeat in Essex County Women's League
arts.sum: Two goals in the first half were added to by a further four in the second, with Ruby Greenleaf netting a consolation in added time for the U's in the Essex County Women's League premier division defeat. A potential break from Gamble in the 29th couldn’t find Greenleaf or Williams and subsequent loose balls up to the half time whistle were swallowed up by a confident keeper and composed back line.

arts.ttl: Cheltenham Town 2 Colchester United 1 - reaction from Danny Cowley after defeat
arts.sum: "Unfortunately, if you make two mistakes and you concede two goals away from home, you don't normally win even though we'd done so many good things with the ball against a really aggressive opponent. "We conceded a really bad goal that knocked us and took us a little while to find our rhythm but once we did that, I thought we played some really good football," continued Cowley.
